Asteroids, such a throwback!
This is definitely up there as one of the most known
arcade classics! Though, for a game created in 1979,
it had a higher resolution than games we play today!
That's because it uses vector graphics.

This space-themed multidirectional shooter
arcade game designed by Lyle Rains and Ed Logg was
one of the first major hits of the golden age of
arcade games; the game sold over 70,000 cabinets
and proved both popular with players...

...and influential with developers!
As aforementioned, the game is rendered on a vector
display; a type of CRT, similar to that of an early
oscilloscope. In a vector display, the image is
composed of drawn lines...

...rather than a grid of glowing pixels
as in raster graphics. Such is the case for games
like PacMan. This limitation is what gives Asteroids
it's simple white shape aesthetic.
...

It's called 'Space Rocks'...
Probably some knockoff.

Rotate Ship : WASD or Arrow Keys
Shoot : Spacebar
Restart : R
